name: One-Click Mobile Checkout
description: Test hypothesis that one-click checkout increases mobile conversion

inputs.featureIdea: Add one-click checkout button on mobile product pages that uses saved payment and shipping information
inputs.targetAudience: mobile users with saved payment information browsing product pages

expectedHypothesis.statement: We believe adding one-click checkout for mobile users with saved payment information will increase mobile conversion rate by 15%. We'll know we're right when mobile purchase completion increases from 2.5% to 2.9% (statistically significant at p<0.05).
assumptions: Mobile users abandon checkout due to friction (form filling)
Users trust one-click purchases on mobile
Saved payment information is current and valid
Reducing steps from 5 to 1 will overcome abandonment
risks: Users don't trust one-click on mobile (security concerns)

expectedMetrics.primary: Mobile conversion rate (purchases / product page views)
